abstract: BHP’s decision was all but preordained after the Canadian government said earlier this month that the deal did not represent a “net benefit” to Canada.
snippet: BHP’s decision was all but preordained after the Canadian government said earlier this month that the deal did not represent a “net benefit” to Canada.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton said on Sunday that it withdrew its $38.6 billion unsolicited takeover offer for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, the world’s biggest producer of a key fertilizer ingredient, after the Canadian government blocked the potential deal.

headline.main: BHP Billiton Drops Bid for Potash
headline.print_headline: BHP Billiton Drops Bid for Potash

abstract: The investment banks advising BHP Billiton would have earned an estimated $140 million in total financial advisory fees if there had been a deal.
snippet: The investment banks advising BHP Billiton would have earned an estimated $140 million in total financial advisory fees if there had been a deal.
lead_paragraph: As Marius Kloppers’s plan to buy the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan evaporated over the weekend, the chief executive of BHP Billiton is once again stuck with the bills.

headline.main: Banks Lose Out on Fees as Potash Bid Is Withdrawn
